content.question: Which of the following best explains the increase in pressure of the <math alttext="C 4 H 10, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> when its volume is decreased from <math alttext="0.50 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="0.21 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.21</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The molecules strike the walls of the vessel more frequently.
The molecules strike the walls of the vessel with different orientations.
The molecules strike the walls of the vessel with greater force.
The molecules decompose to produce a greater number of particles.

content.answer: The molecules strike the walls of the vessel more frequently.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
